title: Clinical Talks
text:
0.1 What this is
Welcome to Clinical Talks, a resident-facing collection of concise clinical topic outlines. Content is intentionally lightweight while we port and curate the archive materials.
Clinical Talks is a living set of short, high-yield talk pages meant to support bedside teaching, pre-round review, and rapid refreshers for common inpatient topics. TODO: Expand the project overview.

title: Clinical Talks
text:
0.2 Intended audience

Internal medicine residents and fellows.
Subspecialty trainees looking for quick refreshers.
TODO: Clarify broader audiences as needed.

title: Clinical Talks
text:
0.3 How to use this site

Pick a topic from the sidebar.
Scan the learning objectives and bottom line.
Review the approach and red flags before rounds.
TODO: Add guidance for contributing updates.

title: Clinical Talks
text:
0.4 How this site is organized

Each topic lives in talks/ and follows a standard outline.
Raw source materials (slides, notes, PDFs) live in archive/ and are linked from each talk.
Topics are grouped into sections to keep navigation focused:

Airway & Ventilation
Pulmonary & Sleep
Critical Care
Cardiology & Vascular
Renal & Metabolic
Infectious & Immune
Procedures & Devices
Environmental & Occupational
Education & Research
Presentations
Miscellaneous
TODO: Refine taxonomy as new talks are curated.

title: Clinical Talks
text:
0.5 Disclaimer
This resource is for education only and does not constitute medical advice. Always follow local guidelines and consult supervising clinicians. TODO: Expand as needed.
